snippet: An American official said the United States and its partners would wait for Iran to take concrete steps to constrain the pace and scope of its nuclear program before easing any sanctions.
abstract: Iran is expected to offer to scale back its effort to enrich uranium, move that a year ago would have been a significant concession to the West; Iran's nuclear abilities have advanced so far since then that experts say it will take far more than that to assure the West that it does not have the capacity to quickly produce a nuclear weapon.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and THOMAS ERDBRINK
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Geneva, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: An American official said the United States and its partners would wait for Iran to take concrete steps to constrain the pace and scope of its nuclear program before easing any sanctions.

headline.main: In New Nuclear Talks, Technological Gains by Iran Pose Challenges to the West
headline.print_headline: In New Nuclear Talks, Technological Gains by Iran Pose Challenges to the West
